{"step_by_step_thinking": "The child has ingested multiple medications, but the one that is most likely causing his symptoms is aspirin. Aspirin overdose can cause a mixed respiratory alkalosis and metabolic acidosis. The child's symptoms of lethargy, vomiting, and tinnitus (indicated by the child grasping at his ears) are consistent with salicylate toxicity. In the early stages of aspirin overdose, respiratory alkalosis occurs due to direct stimulation of the respiratory centers in the medulla, leading to hyperventilation and a decrease in PCO2. As the condition progresses, metabolic acidosis occurs due to the accumulation of organic acids. Therefore, the arterial blood gas readings would likely show a decreased pH (indicating acidosis), decreased PCO2 (indicating respiratory compensation), and decreased HCO3- (indicating metabolic acidosis).", "answer_choice": "B. pH 7.35, PCO2 29 mmHg, and HCO3- 15 mEq/L"}
